identified-content.person: NEVEL, KARI ANDREA VAN (KARI ANDREA VAN BUCKARD)

block.p: Kari Andrea Van Nevel, a daughter of Lois E. Van Nevel and J. Paul Van Nevel of Potomac, Md., was married yesterday to Matthew Hall Buckard, the son of Penelope D. Buckard and Donald L. Buckard of Watchung, N.J. The Rev. Ervin Brown performed the ceremony at Christ Episcopal Church in St. Michaels, Md.

Mrs. Buckard, 33, is the senior director of product operations at ClickThings! an Internet company in New York that helps businesses create, manage and edit their own Web sites. She graduated from Mount Holyoke College and received an M.B.A. from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Her father, who retired as the associate director for communications at the National Cancer Institute in Bethesda, Md., is a consultant on public relations for health-care organizations. Her mother, also retired, was a teacher at the Seven Locks Baptist Nursery School in Potomac.

Kari Andrea Van Nevel, a daughter of Lois E. Van Nevel and J. Paul Van Nevel of Potomac, Md., was married yesterday to Matthew Hall Buckard, the son of Penelope D. Buckard and Donald L. Buckard of Watchung, N.J. The Rev. Ervin Brown performed the ceremony at Christ Episcopal Church in St. Michaels, Md.

Mrs. Buckard, 33, is the senior director of product operations at ClickThings! an Internet company in New York that helps businesses create, manage and edit their own Web sites. She graduated from Mount Holyoke College and received an M.B.A. from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Her father, who retired as the associate director for communications at the National Cancer Institute in Bethesda, Md., is a consultant on public relations for health-care organizations. Her mother, also retired, was a teacher at the Seven Locks Baptist Nursery School in Potomac.

Mr. Buckard, 34, is a director of network operations at Tradescape.com, an online stock trading company in New York. He graduated from Colgate University and received a certificate in networks from the Computer Technology and Applications Program at Columbia University. His mother is the office manager at Atlantic Traffic and Design Engineers in Watchung. His father is a vice president for commercial accounts at Bollinger Insurance in Short Hills, N.J.
